radiofeed.common.db module¶

class radiofeed.common.db.FastCountMixin¶

Bases: object

Provides faster alternative to COUNT for very large tables, using PostgreSQL retuple SELECT.

If table count less than 1000 or is filtered then does a standard COUNT query.

count()¶

radiofeed.common.decorators module¶

radiofeed.common.decorators.ajax_login_required(view)¶

Use this decorator instead of @login_required when handling HTMX fragment and JSON requests. For standard requests and full page HTMX responses use Django @login_required.

If an HTMX request returns a client redirect to login page if user is not logged in, otherwise raises a 401.

Parameters:

view (Callable) – Django view callable

Returns:

decorated callable

Return type:

Callable

radiofeed.common.pagination module¶

radiofeed.common.pagination.pagination_response(request, object_list, template_name, pagination_template_name, extra_context=None, target='object-list', page_size=30, param='page', **pagination_kwargs)¶

Creates a TemplateResponse for a paginated QuerySet or list.

If the request has the HX-Request header and matching HTMX target, will select the pagination template instead of the default template. The pagination template should be included in the default template and ensure the correct hx-target is also included.

The following items are added to the template context:

page_obj: Page instance pagination_template: pagination template name pagination_target: HTMX target

Example:

default template:

{% include pagination_template %}

pagination template:

<div id="{{ pagination_target }}">

    {% include "includes/pagination_links.html" %}

    {% for podcast in page_obj.object_list %}
        {% include "podcasts/podcast.html" %}
    {% empty %}
        {% include "includes/empty.html" %}
    {% endfor %}

    {% include "includes/pagination_links.html" %}
</div>
Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) –

  • object_list (Iterable) – QuerySet or list of items

  • template_name (str) – default template used if no matching HTMX headers

  • pagination_template_name (str) – template used if matching HTMX headers

  • extra_context (dict | None) – extra template context

  • target (str) – HTMX target

  • page_size (int) – number of items per page

  • param (str) – query string parameter for page

  • **pagination_kwargs – other Paginator kwargs

Returns:

TemplateResponse

Raises:

Http404 – invalid page

radiofeed.common.template.pagination_url(context, page_number, param='page')¶

Inserts the “page” query string parameter with the provided page number into the template, preserving the original request path and any other query string parameters.

Given the above and a URL of “/search?q=test” the result would be something like:

“/search?q=test&page=3”

Parameters:

  • context (dict) – template context

  • page_number (int) –

  • param (str) – query string parameter for pages

Returns:

updated URL path with new page

Return type:

str
